content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same problem, even if the question is phrased differently, the conclusion should remain consistent.)

The shortest path from node 5 to node 1 in the graph is:

5 -> 2 -> 5 -> 4

In other words, the shortest path is to start at node 5, go to node 2, then go to node 5 again, and finally go to node 4. Note that this is the shortest path that exists in the graph. There may be other paths that are shorter but not in this format.

The shortest path from node 5 to node 1 in the graph is:

5 -> 2 -> 4

In other words, the shortest path is to start at node 5, go to node 2, and finally go to node 4. Note that this is the shortest path that exists in the graph. There may be other paths that are shorter but not in this format.
